| HistoryText             = 
===Origin===
[[Parker Robbins (Earth-616)|Hood]] formed this group of criminals during his tenure as the [[Kingpin|Kingpin of Crime]] in [[New York City]]. While the [[New Avengers (Earth-616)|New Avengers]] were fighting a [[Symbiotes|symbiote]] outbreak in [[Manhattan]], Hood used a [[Deathlok (Robot) (Earth-616)|Deathlok]] to rob a bank in [[New Jersey (State)|New Jersey]], then used the proceeds as seed money to recruit a large number of supervillains. As luck would have it, a recent breakout had left most of the villains free, but struggling to get by, so his offer was well-received.{{r|New Avengers Vol 1 35}}

With a close council of advisors and enforcers, Hood led his people in a fight against [[Luke Cage (Earth-616)|Luke Cage's]] New Avengers, which he lost through the actions of [[Stephen Strange (Earth-616)|Doctor Strange]]. However, the Hood was able to use his magic gear to get them out of jail quickly.{{r|New Avengers Vol 1 36|37}}

===Secret Invasion===
The group was active during the [[Deviant Skrulls|Skrulls]] [[Secret Invasion]], where they sided with the other human heroes against the aliens.{{r|Secret Invasion #6}} As Hood's syndicate was attacking the Skulls, it was revealed that they had known there were Skrulls in hiding as Skrull agents had tried to replace [[Giuletta Nefaria (Earth-616)|Madame Masque]] but failed. When advised to use his magic to scan the villains present, Hood discovered that [[Ulysses Lugman (Skrull) (Earth-616)|Slug]] had been replaced by a Skrull and killed him.{{r|New Avengers #46}}

===Dark Reign===
In the wake of this, the group began to benefit from their leader's alliance with [[Norman Osborn (Earth-616)|Norman Osborn]],{{r|Secret Invasion: Dark Reign #1}} the new American homeland security czar and head of the [[Strategic Homeland Intervention, Enforcement and Logistics Division (Earth-616)|S.H.I.E.L.D.]] replacement known as [[H.A.M.M.E.R. (Earth-616)|H.A.M.M.E.R.]]. In this new environment, the organization consolidated its control of the New York criminal underworld, and began to spread in new directions: sending members to join the [[50-State Initiative (Earth-616)|Initiative]]{{r|Avengers: The Initiative Vol 1 25}} and also tried to control the zombie virus.{{r|{{cl|Marvel Zombies 4 Vol 1 1}}-[[Marvel Zombies 4 Vol 1 4|4]]}} At the same time they continued to face opposition from rebel heroes such as the New Avengers{{r|New Avengers Vol 1 50}}{{r|New Avengers Vol 1 52|53}} and the [[Frank Castle (Earth-616)|Punisher]],{{r|Punisher Vol 8 5|10}} and even from independent villains, like [[Mike Nero (Earth-616)|Enforcer]]{{r|Dark Reign: Made Men Vol 1 1#The Enforcer}} and [[Mister Negative (Earth-616)|Mister Negative]].{{r|Dark Reign: Mister Negative Vol 1 1|3}}

During this time, [[Jonas Harrow (Earth-616)|Jonas Harrow]], a high-ranking member of the group, found the remains of a device intended to nullify superpowers, and rebuilt it, able to include or exclude people from its effect. When the Hood lost his powers and had to go on a journey to recover them, Harrow struck, taking control of the gang and fighting the New Avengers and Osborn's "official" [[Dark Avengers (Earth-616)|Avengers]] team. When Hood got back, he killed Harrow and retook the group.{{r|New Avengers #60}}

===Siege===
In the wake of this, the group became part of Norman Osborn's plan to invade Asgard, with the promise of government-mandated immunity from prosecution for all members if they were successful.{{r|Origins of Siege Vol 1 1}} Unfortunately, due to a combination of plans coming to fruition, the invasion was thwarted, and in the confusion, the group's members were all either arrested or had to flee, and the group's power was spent.{{r|Siege #3|4}}

===Return===
Years later, The Hood took a second shot at becoming the new kingpin of New York following Wilson Fisk's exit from the underworld.{{r|Defenders Vol 5 8}} After the fall of Kingpin runner-up [[Willis Stryker (Earth-616)|Diamondback]] at the hands of the [[Defenders (Manhattan) (Earth-616)|Defenders]], The Hood grabbed hold of his territory and operations. He reunited many former members of his old army, and intended to form a new alliance, dividing New York in territories and assigning one supervillain to act as said territory's indisputable kingpin. Even though the meeting was interrupted by the Defenders and numerous of their allies,{{r|Defenders Vol 5 10}} the reformation of The Hood's army moved forward. One of their first actions consisted on targeting [[Victor von Doom (Earth-616)|Victor von Doom]], who had turned a new leaf and had become the new [[Iron Man]].{{r|Invincible Iron Man Vol 1 595}}

Hood's Gang ambushed Iron Man in the ruins of [[Castle Doom (Doomstadt)|Castle Doom]] where Hood used his demonic bullets to knock him off balance, allowing the rest of the army to gang up on him and knock him out. With Victor von Doom down on the ground, Hood ordered his minions to tear the place apart and uncover its secrets.{{r|Invincible Iron Man Vol 1 597}} [[Dirk Garthwaite (Earth-616)|Wrecker]] worked to open up Victor's Iron Man armor as he was being restrained by [[Stuart Clarke (Earth-616)|Rampage]] and [[Lancaster Sneed (Earth-616)|Shockwave]]. Before Wrecker could finish the job, Victor teleported away in a bright flash. Hood suspected that he and [[Anthony Stark (Earth-616)|Tony Stark]] were connected and that they had to find Tony Stark in order to get to Victor's wealth.{{r|Invincible Iron Man Vol 1 598}}
